content:
There are several researchers in India who study mangroves and their ecological, economic, and cultural importance. Here are a few notable ones:

1. Dr. C. R. Srinivasan, Department of Marine Biology, Annamalai University, Tamil Nadu
2. Dr. Jayaraman Kalaiselvan, National Institute of Oceanography, Goa
3. Dr. V. Murugesan, Centre for Marine and Coastal Studies, Anna University, Chennai
4. Dr. K. Venkataraman, Indian Institute of Technology, Chennai
5. Dr. S. K. Das, School of Environmental Sciences, Jawaharlal Nehru University, Delhi

These are just a few examples of researchers in India who study mangroves. There are many others who are conducting important research in this field, both in academia and government organizations.
